subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] why  'why'?
msgSnippet: ... _Wear_ and _where_, _wet_ and _whet_. I m sure there are more, but I d agree the functional load is low. Now if someone can prove there are no /h/ -- /N/
messageBody:
peter_r_guinness skrev:
> Can anyone find a minimal pair for 'way' and 'why'? If not
> then they both represent allophones of the same phomene.
> Since we seem to agree that we should use phonemic
> principles by employing lexical sets, doesn't that mean
> that one of them is redundant and that it should be
> deprecated? Eg: 'why' should be removed from the alphabet.

_Wear_ and _where_, _wet_ and _whet_.

I'm sure there are more, but I'd agree the functional
load is low.

Now if someone can prove there are no /h/ -- /N/
minimal pairs...

/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
No man forgets his original trade: the rights of
nations and of kings sink into questions of grammar,
if grammarians discuss them.
-Dr. Samuel Johnson (1707 - 1784)
